description: From Middle French médiocrité, from Latin mediocritās, from mediocris.

entries.meaning: (now rare) The quality of being intermediate between two extremes; a mean.
(obsolete) A middle course of action; moderation, balance.
examples: In adversity I wish for prosperity, and in prosperity I am afraid of adversity. What mediocrity may be found?

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The condition of being mediocre; having only an average degree of quality, skills etc.; no better than standard.
An individual with mediocre abilities or achievements.
